title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora advises focusing on current games rather than discussing playoff scenarios prematurely.
Boston holds the second wild card in the AL, trailing the Yankees by 1.5 games; their playoff chance is over 90%.
Injuries, particularly to Roman Anthony, complicate Boston's lineup choices against left-handed pitchers like Max Fried.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow aims to hire a new general manager to serve as second-in-command this offseason.
The general manager role has been vacant since Breslow was appointed to lead baseball operations in 2024.
Assistant GMs Ferreira, Romero, Groopman, Smith, and Toboni are potential candidates for the GM role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick.
Patriots also give up a 2028 seventh-round selection in the deal.
Polk underperformed since the 2024 draft, with only 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to break a five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami as they face off in Week 2.
Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel faces scrutiny after a blowout loss to the Colts and a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa holds a 7-0 record against the Patriots, completing 69% of passes with four interceptions in those games.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed an intense Southern Gothic set at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
The concert featured a mix of tracks from various albums, including 'Preacherâ€™s Daughter' and 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You'.
Toronto-based band 9Million opened for Cain, while Jae Matthews of Boy Harsher joined her for a duet during the performance.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis returns to football portraying Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film about overcoming past regrets.
Chiklis, known for tough roles, tackles football again at 62 after last playing at Andover High in 1980.
Film premieres in Boston on September 14, with a nationwide release on September 19, featuring Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Forbes' list of 400 richest Americans includes nine Massachusetts residents, with net worths ranging from $3.9 billion to $35 billion.
Abigail Johnson, with a net worth of $35 billion, is the richest Massachusetts resident and ranks 27th overall on the list.
Robert Kraft, Patriots owner, is the 78th wealthiest American with a net worth of $13.8 billion, reflecting his sports and esports investments.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway Park, mustering only two hits in a key series opener.
Boston's offensive struggles continued, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position and committing three errors.
Yankees have a 99.3% postseason chance, Red Sox 95.4%; series could impact Wild-Card host and division race.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Green Bay Packers.
The former Patriots defensive end, 31, will require surgery after the injury sustained while blocking an extra point.
Wise Jr. signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Washington Commanders in March 2025.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early is being considered for a start against the Athletics at Fenway Park next week.
Early impressed in his MLB debut with 11 strikeouts and five scoreless innings against the A's.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is evaluating rotation options, including fellow young pitchers Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.
